intro: Torulinium flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible torul, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems that often trail along the ground, giving it a creeping growth habit. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Torulinium flexuosum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
